page.title: 14TEMPLETON AIRFIELD CLUBS.
page.content: The Gliding Club was founded by Gilroy Phillips in 1960. It began at Withybush Airfield in Haverfordwest. The 25th Anniversary is this year, 1985. About 50 to 60 people attend on Saturdays and Sundays.The membership fee is Â£50 a year and members pay Â£2 per day when they attend. Flights last about 10 minutes. Visitors pay Â£6 per flight. Gliders hold two people. The club owns three gliders, 2 K_10s, and one T_21s. They only fly in good weather conditions. The Club takes part in shows and gives rides. There have been several crashes and one man was killed. There is also a Model Aircraft Club on Templeton Airfield. Members make and fly their model aeroplanes.
